channel.title: Is there a way?
channel.description: is it true i cant make my server or make my ip as a domain through apache/wamp because im on a dongle atm and it has an elastic ip.?

item.title: Is there a way?
item.dc:creator: @puffer puffer
item.description:
@puffer wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:14, topic:441845"][quote author=puffer link=topic=544524.msg3992200#msg3992200 date=1336750943]

well i tried to put my ip in the settings and it doesn’t work?

  1. Do you have the correct settings in your server files?
  2. Have you configured your firewall to allow connections to your computer?
  3. Does your USB internet stick have a firewall that could be blocking connections to your computer?
    [/quote]
    Internet stick with firewall…LOL.[/quote]

I do believe they exist if I am not mistaken

Read full topic

item.title: Is there a way?

well i tried to put my ip in the settings and it doesn’t work?
[/quote]

  1. Do you have the correct settings in your server files?
  2. Have you configured your firewall to allow connections to your computer?
  3. Does your USB internet stick have a firewall that could be blocking connections to your computer?[/quote]
    Internet stick with firewall…LOL.

item.title: Is there a way?
item.dc:creator: @puffer puffer
item.description:
@puffer wrote:

Captain Jack Sparrow:

well i tried to put my ip in the settings and it doesn’t work?

  1. Do you have the correct settings in your server files?
  2. Have you configured your firewall to allow connections to your computer?
  3. Does your USB internet stick have a firewall that could be blocking connections to your computer?

item.title: Is there a way?
item.dc:creator: @puffer puffer
item.description:
@puffer wrote:

Actually if you have a static ip, you really don’t even need to setup no-ip. You can simply use your ip in the client settings and it will work. Either way works though so its you choice!

Read full topic

item.title: Is there a way?
item.dc:creator: @Captain_Jack_Sparrow Captain Jack Sparrow
item.description:

thanks will have a go at that.

item.title: Is there a way?
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Just create a no-ip account and download the DUC, then create a no-ip domain, and you will have a address that always works, and updates whenever your ip changes.

Read full topic

item.title: Is there a way?

@freaky5000 wrote:

Dongle is a world wide term, used for a usb internet device… And it should not matter, aslong as you have in IP address.

Anyway, it there is most likely a way to do it.
